sentences.sContent: It took us a while to realize the extent of the tragedy.
sentences.sCn: 我们过了一段时间才意识到这场悲剧有多严重。

sentences.sContent: It was only later that I realized my mistake.
sentences.sCn: 我到后来才认识到自己的错误。

sentences.sContent: She never realized her ambition of winning an Olympic gold medal.
sentences.sCn: 中文例句:她一直未能实现赢取奥运会金牌的抱负。

sentences.sContent: ...people need to realize that bees are valuable and they should be looked after...
...we need to realize first of all that there are many things we dont know...
...I didn’t realize I’ve being bothering you all this time...
...We should realize our dream step by step...
...I realize that what distressed my father wasn't so much the Mr...
...we ought to fully realize the importance of reading literature...
...we need to realize that the virtual net could never take place of the face-to-face communication among human beings...
...Most Facebook users don’t realize this is happening...
...shift our mindsets and realize that diversity opens doors for all of us...
...Attending the diversity workshop helped me realize how much I could learn by simply asking questions and creating dialogues with my employees...

synos.tran: 实现；认识到；了解；将某物卖得

phrases.pCn: 变卖产业；变卖产业以得现款

words.tran: [数] 可实现的；可实行的；可感觉到的
实际上，事实上；真正地，真实地；真的吗？（表语气）
现实主义；实在论；现实主义的态度和行为
实现（realize的过去式及过去分词）

trans.tranOther: to know and understand something, or suddenly begin to understand it
